main_text.sentence: Three negibacterial phyla that share a rare 4-amino acid insertion in alanyl-tRNA synthetase [1,81] together correspond closely to the classical division Gracilicutes, so I designate them 'core gracilicutes' (Proteobacteria, Sphingobacteria, Planctobacteria).

Unlike in Posibacteria, flagella of Exoflagellata (Proteobacteria plus Planctobacteria), Salinibacter, and Thermotoga have an L-ring [78], formed by FlgH lipoprotein, which embeds them neatly into the OM in a manner allowing free rotation.
